title: Album Page, "Timbered Buildings, Strassburg", September 10, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: recto, in graphite, from bottom left: white house (light yellow); from bottom center: (light yellow) (little darker yellow / touched with brown)  - (pink) / Strassburg / Sept 10th 1887; at bottom right corner:  (pink)  (green blinds) (red roof); at upper right corner (inscribed in a circle): 34 / 46
description: Vertical sheet with view of buildings on either side of a narrow road with figures.  The road bends to the right, and lining the street at left are multi-story half-timbered structures, their second stories overhanging deeply and supported by larger wooden brackets.  Many have their shutters open, and the upper story windows shielded by a canopy when the shutters are not present.  The roofs are steeply pitched and lined with tiles.  At the bottom of the sheet, the artist has given a guide for colors seen here.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Timbered Buildings, Strassburg", September 10, 1887.
September 10, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-115.
